meanings.definition: To offer a higher price than someone else in order to purchase something.
meanings.sent1: She kept outbidding the other buyers at the auction.
meanings.sent2: The businessman won the painting by outbidding his competitors.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbidding the dog for the last piece of fish was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outbid everyone else was like a fierce storm in the bidding war.
meanings.sent5: Outbidding is like a race where the fastest wallet wins.

meanings.definition: To surpass in a bidding competition.
meanings.sent1: The young entrepreneur outbidding the established companies was impressive.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outbid his opponents in the final round of the auction.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outbidding the birds for the last acorn was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her strategy to outbid the competition was a shining beacon of success.
meanings.sent5: Outbidding is like climbing to the top of the bidding mountain.

meanings.definition: To exceed in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: The team's performance outbidding all expectations surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outbid her colleagues in sales numbers.
meanings.sent3: The sun outbidding the clouds to shine through made the day brighter.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outbid the challenges was like a warrior in battle.
meanings.sent5: Outbidding is like a sprint to the finish line of success.
